channel.title: Global Logistics & Wholesale Trade News
channel.description: Daily updates on global supply chain, freight, and trade policy.

item.title: US Layoffs Surge to 108k in January; Logistics Hit Hardest
item.description: Challenger, Gray & Christmas reports that U.S. layoffs in January hit 108,435—the highest January total since 2009—with heavy impacts in transportation and warehousing sectors.

item.title: Bank of Canada: US Tariffs to Cap Growth at 1.3%
item.description: The Bank of Canada warns that "structural change" due to new US tariffs will lead to a 1.3% growth cap for 2026, impacting cross-border wholesale trade.

item.title: US and China Agree to Trade Truce Until November
item.description: Reports emerge of a diplomatic "Truce" between the US and China, pausing new export controls and tariff escalations until November 2026.

item.title: India’s Vizhinjam Port Sets Monthly Volume Record
item.description: Vizhinjam Port sets a new record with 123,092 TEUs handled in a single month, establishing itself as a key transshipment hub for South Asia.

item.title: Agility Index: 98% of Logistics Firms Now Use AI
item.description: The 2026 Agility Emerging Markets Logistics Index reveals that 98% of logistics companies have integrated AI to manage supply chain volatility.

item.title: Panama Court Strikes Down China-Linked Port Deal
item.description: A Panama Court has struck down a major port concession deal near the Canal citing national security concerns, disrupting long-term regional logistics planning.

item.title: New IMO Fire Safety Regulations Take Effect
item.description: New International Maritime Organization (IMO) regulations mandating stricter fire-fighting and cargo-securing standards for container ships are now in force.

item.title: IMF: Global Inflation Cools to 3.8%
item.description: The IMF reports global inflation is cooling to 3.8%, providing some relief to wholesalers, though service-sector logistics costs remain "sticky."

item.title: Reefer Rejection Rates Spike to 20% on Weather
item.description: Ryder and FreightWaves report that refrigerated truck rejection rates peaked at 20% due to severe ice storms affecting the US interior.

item.title: CIPS: Logistics Costs Rose Over 10% in Late 2025
item.description: The Chartered Institute of Procurement & Supply reports that 22% of procurement leaders saw logistics costs rise by over 10% in the last quarter.

item.title: Logistics Manager’s Index Drops to 54.2
item.description: The LMI reads 54.2 for January, showing a 31% year-over-year drop in available transport capacity, indicating tightening markets.

item.title: I-40 Ice Storm Costs Logistics Sector $1.2B
item.description: A major ice storm freezing the I-40 corridor has caused an estimated $1.2B in lost logistics productivity due to stranded fleets.

item.title: Georgia Ports Authority Volume Hits 5.5M TEUs
item.description: GPA confirms 2025 was its second-busiest year ever, totaling 5.5 million TEUs, driven by East Coast cargo shifts.

item.title: Supreme Court Hears IEEPA Tariff Arguments
item.description: The US Supreme Court begins hearing oral arguments regarding the executive use of IEEPA to impose broad tariffs.

item.title: Drewry Index Falls 4% to $2,445
item.description: The Drewry World Container Index decreased 4% to $2,445 per 40ft container, reflecting softening demand post-holiday.

item.title: US Dollar Rallies on Eurozone Trade Fears
item.description: The US dollar recovers slightly as investors hedge against potential Eurozone trade volatility and tariff disputes.

item.title: UPS Cuts 30,000 Jobs in $3B Savings Push
item.description: UPS announces plans to cut 30,000 positions and close 24 buildings to save $3 billion following volume losses from Amazon.

item.title: India and EU Sign Historic Free Trade Agreement
item.description: The EU and India officially sign a deal to eliminate tariffs on over 96% of goods, expected to double EU exports to India by 2032.

item.title: Gatik Secures Major Retail Contracts for Autonomous Trucks
item.description: Autonomous trucking firm Gatik secures major multi-year contracts, signaling a transition to large-scale middle-mile autonomy.

item.title: US Imposes 25% Tariff on Iran-Linked Supply Chains
item.description: The US implements a 25% tariff on goods from entities trading with Iran, impacting Asian electronics supply chains.

item.title: WTO Slashes 2026 Trade Growth Forecast to 0.5%
item.description: The World Trade Organization cuts its merchandise trade growth forecast from 1.8% to 0.5%, citing the delayed impact of tariff hikes.

item.title: US Cancels Retaliatory Tariffs on European Partners
item.description: The US administration formally cancels the proposed 10% "Greenland-related" retaliatory tariffs against eight European trading partners.

item.title: Trucking Spot Rates Hit $2.46/Mile Despite Low Demand
item.description: National trucking data shows spot rates reaching a peak of $2.46 per mile in January, a 9.1% year-over-year increase.

item.title: Inventory Front-Loading Index Drops 15%
item.description: Global "front-loading" index drops 15%, signaling the end of the 2025 inventory stockpiling surge as warehouses reach capacity.

item.title: New Section 232 Tariffs on Minerals & Semis
item.description: New US Section 232 measures add tariffs and quotas on critical minerals and semiconductors to bolster domestic production.

item.title: Intra-Asia Freight Index Drops 6% as Manufacturing Shifts
item.description: The Intra-Asia container freight index dropped 6% this week as regional manufacturing continues shifting toward Vietnam and Thailand.

item.title: West Coast Port Volumes Jump 20% Pre-Holiday
item.description: West Coast port volumes surged 20–30% above normal levels as importers rushed cargo before the Lunar New Year shutdown.

item.title: Canada and China Reach Deal on Canola Tariffs
item.description: Canada and China sign an "Agreement-in-Principle" to slash canola seed tariffs from 85% to 15%, easing agricultural trade tensions.

item.title: UNCTAD: Global GDP Growth Stagnant at 2.6%
item.description: UNCTAD projects global growth to remain at 2.6% for 2026, noting a "liquidity crunch" hitting developing economies.

item.title: Amazon Cuts Middle-Mile Management Roles
item.description: Amazon initiates a "January Restructuring," cutting middle-mile management roles by 5% as it streamlines its logistics network.

item.title: Air Cargo Demand Rises 5.5% YoY
item.description: IATA reports air cargo demand rose 5.5% year-over-year in early January, led by high-growth lanes in Africa and Asia-Pacific.

item.title: World Bank: Geopolitics Now Dictates 25% of Trade
item.description: The World Bank reports that "geopolitical distance" now influences 25% of all global trade flows, up significantly from previous decades.

item.title: Port of Saint John Completes C$247M Upgrade
item.description: The Port of Saint John completes its C$247 million modernization project, quadrupling capacity to 800,000 TEUs.

item.title: FedEx Expands Drone Delivery to 3 New Metros
item.description: FedEx expands its "fenced" autonomous drone delivery pilot to three new US metro areas, targeting last-mile efficiencies.

item.title: Maersk Announces 7 Blank Sailings for Lunar New Year
item.description: Maersk announces seven blank sailings on Transpacific routes to align capacity with mid-February factory closures in China.

item.title: UN Warns of $307B Cost of Water Scarcity
item.description: The UN warns of "Global Water Bankruptcy," estimating $307 billion in annual damages to agriculture and logistics infrastructure.

item.title: FMCSA: 5% of CDL Drivers May Exit on New Rules
item.description: The FMCSA estimates 5% of CDL holders may exit the workforce due to new immigration-linked labor and reporting rules.

item.title: Global Manufacturing Tariffs Rise to 6.7%
item.description: Manufacturing tariffs rose to an average of 6.7% globally at the start of 2026, continuing a trend of rising protectionism.

item.title: Mexico Hikes Tariffs on 1,400 Products
item.description: Effective Jan 1, Mexico increased tariffs (10% to 50%) on over 1,000 products from non-FTA countries including China and South Korea.

item.title: Canada’s Forced Labour Reporting Rules Take Effect
item.description: Canada’s new Forced Labour Reporting rules take effect, mandating strict supply chain disclosures for all importers.
